title: Kids Cough Blood After Being Served Apple Juice At Pennsylvania Restaurant
text:
Kids Cough Blood After Being Served Apple Juice At Pennsylvania Restaurant "As soon as they took a sip ..." by V. Saxena March 7, 2017 at 8:25am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
A routine outing to the Star Buffet & Grill in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, turned into a horrifying affair for one family Friday when two of the children began coughing up blood after downing cups of apple juice. 
“As soon as they took a sip of it, they were throwing up and there was blood you know, and all that stuff,” Richard Zaragoza, Sr., the father of one of the two children affected, told local news station WPMT . 
Both his 10-year-old son, Richard Zaragoza, Jr., and the boy’s mother’s daughter, 4-year-old Ginaya Mendoza, had to be rushed to a nearby hospital and treated for burns to their throat and mouth. Both were still in critical condition as of Monday morning. Advertisement - story continues below 
“He has Cystic Fibrosis and Diabetes, so the concerns are a lot worse,” Richard said of his son, adding that the family had been visiting the buffet for years without any problems. 
WPMT reportedly tried reaching out to Star Buffet & Grill for an explanation but was told only that the juice had been purchased from a local supermarket. 
Moreover, as of Monday, the restaurant was still open for business — something which Richard found distressing. Advertisement - story continues below 
“Still open for business, which is mind-baffling to me,” he said. “You know I haven’t, usually when something like that happens you would think the health inspectors would go and there’d be a full blown investigation.” 
There have in fact already been at least 14 health inspections of the restaurant, eight of which it failed. Three of the inspections were reportedly triggered by customer complaints. The latest inspection last month reportedly uncovered violations involving egg rolls and breaded chicken not being maintained at the required temperature. 
According to reports, an additional inspection was conducted Tuesday and the cups and juice were being analyzed, though the results of these various tests still remain unknown. Advertisement - story continues below
